headline: Kimberly-Clark to pay up to $40 million over sale of adulterated surgical gowns, US DOJ says
summary: Kimberly-Clark Corp has agreed to pay up to $40.4 million to resolve a criminal charge relating to the company's sale of adulterated MicroCool surgical gowns, the U.S. Justice Department said on Thursday.

raw.headline: Kimberly-Clark to pay up to $40 million over sale of adulterated surgical gowns, US DOJ says
raw.summary: Kimberly-Clark Corp has agreed to pay up to $40.4 million to resolve a criminal charge relating to the company's sale of adulterated MicroCool surgical gowns, the U.S. Justice Department said on Thursday.

headline: Kimberly-Clark (KMB) Appoints Stacey Panayiotou As New Chief Human Resources Officer
summary: Kimberly-Clark (KMB) recently appointed Stacey Valy Panayiotou as Chief Human Resources Officer, reflecting the company's focus on experienced leadership. Over the last month, KMB's stock price moved by 1.78%, aligning with broader market trends where major indexes reached record highs. This movement may have been influenced by the company's updated financial guidance and ongoing share buybacks. These corporate events provided a supportive backdrop against the market's overall upward...

headline: Kimberly-Clark Appoints Stacey Valy Panayiotou as Chief Human Resources Officer
summary: Kimberly-Clark Corporation (NASDAQ: KMB) today announced the appointment of Stacey Valy Panayiotou to Chief Human Resources Officer, effective September 10th. Panayiotou will succeed interim Chief Human Resources Officer Viviane Cury, who will resume her prior role as Vice President, Talent Business Partner for North America.

headline: FourKites Recognizes Ardent Mills, Kimberly-Clark, The Coca-Cola Company and Others for Outstanding Achievements in Supply Chain Transformation
summary: CHICAGO, August 28, 2025--FourKites announces 2025 award winners for supply chain excellence, including Ardent Mills, Barilla, Coca-Cola, KCC, and Trane Technologies.
